intro: Echinacea purpurea, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with a distinctive purple-pink hue and a central cone-like structure. The plant has rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. Its roots are rich in compounds that have been traditionally used for their immune-boosting properties. Echinacea purpurea thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and herbal remedies.
